title: Community detection tutorial
text: Preface

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: Community detection tutorial
text:
Description
This is a modeling tutorial for the supplement for Miller-ter Kuile et al. “Accounting for imperfect detection to reveal the importance of current and past environmental conditions for long-term community stability”. in revision
The purpose of this tutorial is to provide a detailed description of the modeling approaches used in the paper.

title: Community detection tutorial
text:
Part 1: description

Multi-species abundance/occupancy modelling (MSAM or MSOM): observational dat with detection covariates to estimate “true” abundance or occupancy
Computer beta diversity given species abundance or occupancy (Bray-Curtis for abundance, species turnover for presence-absence)
Regression model using posterior estimates to examine effects of environmental variables on community change through time (allowing environmental variables to have lagged effects)

title: Community detection tutorial
text:
Part 1.1: Accounting for imperfect detection

Accounting for imperfect detection using Bayesian multi-species model (for either count or detection/non-detection)
[look in supporting info for more]

title: Community detection tutorial
section: Part 1.2 Computing indices of community stability
text:
Part 1.2 Computing indices of community stability

Measured community change (“stability”) through time
